definition: to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

sentences.english: The airline guaranteed that proper adoption procedures would be followed .
sentences.chinese: 航空公司保证按照正当的过继程序办事。

sentences.english: Adoptive cellular immunotherapy is one of the important approaches.
sentences.chinese: 过继性回输免疫效应细胞是其中的重要方法之一。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the therapeutic effect of the new method-adoptive cell immunotherapy on ovarian carcinoma.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨卵巢癌过继细胞免疫治疗新方法。

sentences.english: I haven't got a son, so I adopted one from my eldest brother.
sentences.chinese: 我没儿子，就从大哥家过继了一个嗣子。

sentences.english: Upon his decease all his properties passed to his wife.
sentences.chinese: 由于他的死亡，他所有的财产都过继给了他妻子。

definition: to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
Zhangzi county in Shanxi 山西[Shan1 xi1]
